column2: Instead of governing these conquered territories directly, we can support local sympathisers to govern in our name. By creating a buffer between ourselves and the populace, we reduce the temptation for people to form resistance movements and the collaboration government will encourage like-minded citizens to join our cause. However, they are also highly sensitive to their lack of legitimacy and won’t do anything to jeopardise their support,which will make it harder for us to exploit the area economically.

column2: By turning government over to our military authorities, the area will be governed by means of a highly literal interpretation of the laws. This is a more efficient way to exploit an area economically than a collaboration government, but a slightly less literal interpretation would allow even more resources to be gathered. Because the government has little sensitivity to local conditions, the people will not be happy, but at the same time the legalistic framework means that people could be more unhappy.

column2: Using civilian administrators and focusing on gaining economic advantage from our occupied territories, we can increase the amount of resources we gather from the area.
